intro: Osmoxylon catanduanense, commonly known as the Catanduanes osmoxylon, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic resinous sap. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, with smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a fragrant odor that attracts pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
